com.example.federico.wearableui.viewport

Class ContinuousViewport

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • com.example.federico.wearableui.viewport.Viewport
        • com.example.federico.wearableui.viewport.ContinuousViewport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IContinuousViewport, IViewport

    public class ContinuousViewport
extends Viewport
implements IContinuousViewport
    This class models a specific Viewport that presents a continuity property. This means that this Viewport can be seen as a 2D blackboard that wraps around the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContinuousViewport

        public ContinuousViewport(Context context)
        Constructs a ContinuousViewport with the same dimensions as the device screen.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context.

      • ContinuousViewport

        public ContinuousViewport(Context context,
                          float extraSize)
        Constructs a ContinuousViewport with the passed extra dimensions.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context.
        extraSize - a percentage expressing how much wider and taller the ContinuousViewport will be, compared to the device screen. For example, if 0.5 is passed, a ContinuousViewport that is 50% taller and wider than the device screen will be created.

      • ContinuousViewport

        public ContinuousViewport(Context context,
                          float extraWidth,
                          float extraHeight)
        Constructs a ContinuousViewport with the passed extra dimensions.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context.
        extraWidth - a percentage expressing how much wider the visible part of the ContinuousViewport will be, compared to the device screen. For example, if 0.5 is passed, the visible part of the ContinuousViewport will be 50% wider than the device screen.
        extraHeight - a percentage expressing how much taller the ContinuousViewport will be, compared to the device screen. For example if 0.5 is passed, the ContinuousViewport will be 50% taller than the device screen.

      • scrollAccordingly

        public void scrollAccordingly(float pitch,
                              float yaw)
        Description copied from interface: IViewport
        Scrolls the Viewport by modifying the value of its margins based upon the angles passed as argument. A call to this method also refreshes the Viewport by forcing it to redraw itself.
        Specified by:
        scrollAccordingly in interface IViewport
        Overrides:
        scrollAccordingly in class Viewport
        Parameters:
        pitch - the pitch angle in degrees of the Gaze from its calibration orientation. This will determine of how many pixels the topMargin of the Viewport will change (in other words, this will determine the magnitude of the scrolling along the y axis).
        yaw - the yaw angle in degrees of the Gaze from its calibration orientation. This will determine of how many pixels the leftMargin of the Viewport will change (in other words, this will determine the magnitude of the scrolling along the x axis).

      • getActualExtraWidth

        public int getActualExtraWidth()
        Description copied from interface: IContinuousViewport
        Returns the actual extra width of the Viewport compared to the screen of the device.
        Specified by:
